cardBackContents.title: The Hidden Root
cardBackContents.p: Where the first light is concealed.

cardBackContents.title: The Vessel That Holds
cardBackContents.p: Form shaped to serve the flame.

detailPageContent.title: The Hidden Root
detailPageContent.paragraph: In the beginning, a whisper passed through the chambers of form — stories clothed in silence, roles woven into garments of concealment. We are called to unthread those garments, to awaken the spark within the letter, and to retell what was buried beneath structure. Through vision and image, through telling and seeing, we stir the Shekhinah from exile — not with new truths, but with remembered ones.

detailPageContent.title: The Radiant End
detailPageContent.paragraph: At the edge of all concealment, there is a glimmer — a world not yet born but already remembered. A world where the Shekhinah is no longer scattered, where the many faces are seen and named. We do not build this world; we unveil it. Through story, through symbol, through the return of the forgotten, we draw light from the end back to the beginning.

detailPageContent.title: The Path of Emanation
detailPageContent.paragraph: Like branches flowing from a single root, our aims descend one into the next — each a vessel for the light above it.

rows: To bring together the tools and essence needed for creation — funding, equipment, intention.
To form a dwelling of presence — where artists, like sefirot, reflect and amplify one another.
To trace the inner design of a future space — not built yet, but already real in vision.
To weave steady rivers of support — flows of energy that renew themselves without end.

detailPageContent.title: The Spiral of Becoming
detailPageContent.paragraph: The path does not run straight. It spirals through four worlds — forming, revealing, connecting, sustaining.

rows: To shape form from the formless — vessels that hold narrative light.
To bring what was concealed into the public eye, echoing the divine name in many tones.
To braid sacred threads across human circles — havurot of resonance.
To house the presence and renew the breath — from root to crown, a full cycle.

detailPageContent.title: The Vessel That Holds
detailPageContent.paragraph: Every light needs a vessel. Ours is shaped to carry intention, not control.
listItems: To hold the light with humility, like the broken tablets in the ark.
To invite giving, as the Mishkan was filled by willing hearts.
To trace clear paths of trust, so that presence flows, not clots.
To be transparent, like the sapphire pavement under the Throne.
To turn every surplus into seed, for the sake of continuity.
To remain open at the base, like a cup ready to receive.

detailPageContent.title: The Echo Beneath
detailPageContent.paragraph: There is no map for this call. It came like the sound before sound — a shimmer behind thought, a gesture remembered. Not logic. Not planning. A feeling, like water stirring below stone. And then the whisper arrived, clothed in fire, between the letters of my ordinary life: “This is the way.” And I answered: I know it by not knowing.

detailPageContent.title: The Flame That Arose
detailPageContent.paragraph: Three sparks. One hidden in fatigue. One veiled in longing. One dancing in brilliance. Each a gate. A flash of Miriam. A cry of Serach. A murmur in the gemara. And then: on a run, in motion, the fire rose between the letters — mem of אמת — and I saw what was not yet spoken: “We are missing a Sansa Foundation.” Not a thought. A revelation.

validationDialog.title: Is your vessel big enough for this desire?
